fields.description:
Browse Project should show 'Unassigned Issues' with a count next to it (under By Assignee).

See JRA-117.
fields.summary: Unassigned Issues

fields.description: Allow user to turn on / off emails sent to them.
fields.summary: User Preference: Contact me via email

fields.description: See JRA-108
fields.summary: User Preference: Mail me when I create an issue

fields.description: Create a new preset filter which shows the unscheduled issues (just like the one from the project browser).
fields.summary: Unscheduled Issues Report

fields.description:
Create a new report showing outstanding issues, sorted by votes in decreasing order. 

Of course only shown if the application property 'allow voting' is turned on.
fields.summary: New Report: Voted Issues

fields.description:
Get JIRA running in WL 6.1. 

The main issues at the moment seem to be loading resources / classes and testing supporting projects (eg SiteMesh, WebWork, OSUser).
fields.summary: Weblogic support

fields.description:
OFBiz OSUser providers currently contact the database for every call - which is very inefficient for things like user.inGroup(X) as the user groups do not change very often. 

If exclusive-access is set to true in osuser.xml, the provider should cache all accesses as far as possible, flushing the cache whenever a set() method is called.
fields.summary: Caching OFBiz OSUser providers

fields.description:
Need to write a license key generator / reader system.

License keys will be enterable when setting up JIRA, or changeable in the administration section. 

JIRA will operate without a license for up to 20 issues. 

Free evaluation licenses (created using the generator) will be available from the website via email allowing 30 days unlimited usage.

Non profit / Open Source licenses will also be available via the website once proof of status is provided (ie link to the site or faxed copy of non-profit status). 

Commercial licenses are of course available for those who wish to pay for them ;)
fields.summary: Licensing System

fields.description:
It should be fairly easy to add caching to the Application Properties system by caching the Properties Manager. 

Use a simple map cache where entries are put everytime a get*() is made. Then flush an entry whenever set*() is made with the same key.

We'll then also require a 'flush cache' method (just clear the map) for when data is imported (as lots of properties will be changed in the underlying PropertySet).
fields.summary: Cache the ApplicationProperties

fields.summary: Install failure : Action 'Setup' not found

fields.description: For one thing, the 'by assignee' count shows up with just a count and no name next to it (by assignee should ignore unassigned issues altogether). Also, the project report should have an 'unassigned' count.
fields.summary: browse project not very good at showing unassigned issues

fields.description:
An option for "All" versions (as all known/current versions) would make sense.. more sense than just "None".

Would also be nice if you could set the issue type on step 2 of CreateIssue (might change your mind while filling in the form). You should also be able to change the issue type later on when (re)assigning it.
fields.summary: More options on CreateIssue form

fields.description: When changing bug assignment, there is no 'none' assignment to unassign it.
fields.summary: Impossible to 'unassign' a  bug

fields.description: The developer dropdown in various places should always be alpha sorted
fields.summary: Developer list unsorted

fields.description: Need to be able to customize the (default) columns at least on a per project basis; now there is no way to sort outstanding issues by vote count which would be important for some projects.
fields.summary: User Preference: Customizable columns in IssueNavigator

fields.description: Doesn't seem to be a way to change the default 20 issues returned per page by the filters.. would be enough to have this as a profile option, no need to add yet another field to the filter form.
fields.summary: User Preference: Profile option for issues per page

fields.description: The <select> and <input> fields on the filter form would look a whole lot better (and less bugzillaish) if they were the same width (use CSS width attribute to enforce it).
fields.summary: Ugly filter form on the IssueNavigator

fields.description:
When viewing the bug list, the links to view 'next' and 'previous' results display the right information. However, the 'displaying x to y of z' message consistently has the wrong values. For example:
 'displaying results 20 to 20 of 80', when on the third page of results.
fields.summary: Paging Displays Incorrect Range

fields.description: The email should not include fields that were not specified (eg, if environment is left blank, don't mention it, if no fixfor is chosen ,don't mention it). Also dates are just java date format, which si pretty ugly. Should use a more useful dateformat (no need for sec/ms!). Also, should have a checkbox whether the originator wants to be mailed on the issue. Eg, I just created an issue, so getting an email about it is a bit pointless as I already know about it!
fields.summary: email template for issue created needs cleanup

fields.description: This is very important for tracking project progress. Being able to view reports (with graphs) will make many project manager types very happy (and actually is quite motivating for developers!)  Example reports/graphs  - Bugs fixed this week vs bugs created this week/month - Bugs fixed per developer/week/month/lifetime - Breakdown of changed bugs by status (x bugs are won'tfix, y bugs are resolved, z bugs are nonreproducable)  I'm sure there are many more, maybe even allow users to create custom reports?!
fields.summary: Reporting

fields.description: In cases where jira is being integrated in an existing project, it should be possible to turn off/remove all user management links. Ie, users should not be allowed to change their passwords/profiles within JIRA, as this is handled by some external resources
fields.summary: 'external user management' mode

fields.description: In the second step where JIRA prompts the user, it's impossible to specify an already existing (valid) admin user. The workaround for now is to go ahead and create a new user just to get past setup,then to delete that user and login with credentials that are valid from the specified osuser providers.
fields.summary: Impossible to use existing user during setup

fields.description: When adding issues where the title contains < and > there can be NPE's thrown from SiteMesh like:  java.lang.NullPointerException  at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.parser.FastPageParser.internalParse(Unknown Source)  at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.parser.FastPageParser.parse(Unknown Source)  at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageResponse.getPage(Unknown Source)  at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(Unknown Source)  at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)  at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._deb._lnc(.:376)  at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._deb._wmb(.:170)  at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._co._wbb(.:581)  at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._co._fs(.:189)  at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._bt.run(.:62)
fields.summary: Nasty SiteMesh error when odd chars in summary

fields.summary: Mail transaction failed during CreateIssue

fields.description: When you resolve an issue, the issue 'updated' date does not change to the date of the resolution.
fields.summary: Resolving issues does not change last updated date

fields.description: Similar to JRA-100, except the changelog looks at what has been completed - rather than what is to complete. Looks at history not future.  Another report linked off the browse project screen.  It should show (grouped by version, in reverse sequence order) the fixed issues. Similar linking to JRA-100.
fields.summary: Change log

fields.description: From the Browse Project screen - show links to various reports.  The first report should be a project 'roadmap'.  This shows the issues due to be fixed for unreleased versions, grouped by fix for version. Issues should be linked to view issue, versions should be linked to the issue navigator (fix for that version).
fields.summary: Roadmap

fields.description: Improve the home page (which is displayed when a user first logs in and when they click home).  Highlight the different tasks more clearly on the LHS. Provide link to browse projects.  On the right hand side: - if a project is selected - show mini-reports (5 issues for assigned to user, recently added, recently solved) and links to preset filters - otherwise show project selection area, then when the user selects a project show mini reports.
fields.summary: Improve HOME page

fields.summary: Cannot create issue / cannot refresh GenericEntity

fields.description: Add a filter to show recently resolved issues (ie status=resolved && sort by last updated)
fields.summary: Add filter "Recently Resolved"

fields.description: When the filter form is hidden, the preset filters should still show up below the "SHOW" button.
fields.summary: Preset filters should show up when filter is minimized

fields.description: At the moment anyone creating an issue can set the fix for version. This should only be settable and editable by developers.
fields.summary: Only developers should set fix for

fields.description: When a developer creates an issue, they should be able to assign it directly to another developer.
fields.summary: Developers should be able to assign user on create

fields.description: When viewing a user's profile, the "Assigned Open Issues per project" statistic is always blank.
fields.summary: Assigned Open Issues per project always blank

fields.description: When completing various actions, a browser redirect should be issued (using webwork RedirectAction).   This prevents accidental rerunning of actions when the user hits reload.  For example after editing or creating any entity (eg issue, project, user etc).
fields.summary: After various actions, redirects should be used

fields.description: Link the project name in View Issue to the Browse Project page.
fields.summary: Project in the View Issue page should be linked

fields.description: Filters are still not persisting properly. They are session aware, but the values in the filter form aren't being selected properly based on the current session-stored filter.
fields.summary: Filters are still not session persistent

fields.description: There's currently a bug in exporting whereby carriage returns in any field are lost.  You don't actually lose any data (which is good) but comments and descriptions end up looking ugly (which is bad). As well as that change history will no longer highlight properly.
fields.summary: Export loses carriage returns

fields.description: If you have any summary (or any text field) with quotes in it, the quotes get lost as they aren't escaped.   Results in HTML like so:  <input type="text"        name="summary"        size="60"        value=""Affected Versions" is not ordered correctly in View Issue">  which is of course invalid (see value attribute).   The result is that the text field is unset when submitting the form.
fields.summary: Summary with quotes in it gets lost

fields.description: When resolving an issue, it is often useful to set the fix for so that you have a record of exactly which version the issue was fixed in.
fields.summary: Ability to set Fix For (or Fixed In) when resolving issue

fields.description: When you click 'delete issue' you don't see any details about the issue you are deleting.
fields.summary: Delete Issue doesn't show issue key / summary

fields.description: Should be able to turn email notification on and off after installation, same with public/private and all the other fields. Another thing which might be useful is to have email functionality turned on or off per projects, not per installation
fields.summary: Editable jira properties

fields.description: The problem with defaulting to the lead developer is that bugs which are unassigned stay on him/her. So this presents a biased view in the project summary. This is especially true if there's a 'pool' of issues which people choose to assign to themselves. Resolution: Allow for issues to be unassigned, and to default to that state
fields.summary: Need to support unassigned issues

fields.description: It should say 'assigned to', which is a lot clearer
fields.summary: Asignee is unclear

fields.description: Since user now have emails and usernames, the assign page should provide a link to create a user ONLY IF jira is in public mode. Otherwise, the only thing present on the page should be the developer dropdown
fields.summary: Assign page shouldn't have create user

fields.description: I created a couple of test issues then deleted them, however the count on the ViewProject page says 2 issues, even though the BrowseProject page has all 0's
fields.summary: ViewProject count inconsistent with actual count

fields.description: I get a blank page, looks like a bad url. (ViewProject.jspa?pid=/bugs/secure/admin/DeleteVersion!default.jspa?vid=10000)
fields.summary: Cancel button in delete version dialog doesn't work

fields.summary: Can't create new bugs!

fields.description: When there's just one version in the 'affects versions' row, JIRA still emits a , after it, which looks fairly ugly
fields.summary: 'Affects versions' cosmetic issue

fields.description: I'd imagine the use for this url is so that a user can go to the site to confirm/verify/test a bug while working in JIRA. So it seems logical for this link to be in a new window, rather than the existing one (the link on browseproject for example)
fields.summary: Project url should open in new window

fields.description: Even if the fix for field is updated, going to the EditIssue page never shows what it was last set to. Therefore whenever a bug is edited, one has to select the fix for again, or it gets reset to null.
fields.summary: Fix for field not selected

fields.description: I think a way to create predefined filters and save them on a project level, and on a personal level, is important. As far as I can see, there is no easy way to say "Show me outstanding issues for Version XXX" or some other filter that I may find useful. Being able to edit and save these would make it easy to keep everybody happy with the "Preset Filters" that are up on the top of the Filter panel.
fields.summary: Saved Issue Filters

fields.description: It would be nice if you could add descriptions for project components and versions.
fields.summary: Add descriptions for project components

fields.description: When a user is not logged on - there is not menu system at the top.    It is not immediately clear that the "ATLASSIAN" logo leads to the home page.    This can be solved by either:  - adding the "HOME" menu to the non-logged on screen  - Changing the "ATLASSIAN" logo to a "JIRA" logo  - Allowing end-users to provide their own icons.    Probably more.    A good example of this is the "get password set" dialogue, which has no links back to anywhere, besides the logo.    Also - the logo should be fixed so that the alt text says something meaningful, and add a title tag also.
fields.summary: When not logged on - need better menu features

fields.description: eg:    Affects Versions:    0.6.8, 0.7.4, 0.7.2, 0.7, 0.7.6,    0.7 should be after 0.6.8.  This is already fixed in the dropdowns, so should be a simple fix.
fields.summary: Affected Versions is not ordered correctly in View Issue

fields.description: I've just created a bunch of users.  Now I want to send them an email to explain them what I did and why I enrolled them in Jira and other project/company specific information about using the issue tracking system.  Wouldn't it be nice to just be able to select all or a subset of the users I see in the user browser and then click to a button that will get me to an email compose window (can a mailto: URL contain more than one address ?) with all selected users as recipients ?
fields.summary: Send an email to all (or selected) users from the admin menu

fields.description:
(e.g. : eacute appears as a "y" with a dot over it)

I've entered an accented character (?) in the name of a component for an existing project; the name of the component in the project view (/jira/secure/AddComponent.jspa) does not display the eacute, but another non-ASCII character (a "y" with a dot over it).    Maybe the http request and/or http response does not specify a content-encoding, or one with a plateform-specific charset (like what Windows tools usually do) ??

fields.description: Add the ability for JIRA to run in multiple 'modes'.    The first two modes are:  - public mode - users can signup and view issues themselves, useful for a software company public issue tracker  - private mode - only administrators can create new users, only registered users can login. this better protects your data for a private issue tracker.
fields.summary: JIRA Modes - public/private

fields.description: Currently the level attribute of comments are not exported.    This is a potential security hole as developer/admin comments could be exported, and then could be imported as public comments.
fields.summary: Comment levels are not exported

fields.description: Provide a facility to import the exported XML - thus providing:  - a backup solution  - a way to bulk enter project data  - easy import from Bugzilla using the Bugzilla-DB->XML client  - easy solution to upgrading between versions (following a dump-load strategy similar to databases)
fields.summary: XML Import

fields.description: A single page displaying all the different components for a project, and the status of different issues for the component.    Could work with either open bugs per component, or planned features per component. (For all versions or for a specific version)    See http://www7b.software.ibm.com/webapp/wsdd/wasServlet3?client=form10&SID=1013344492744 for how it might possibly look (I like the graphical status indicators)
fields.summary: Project Summaries

fields.description: The datbase schema used by Jira uses several column names and table names that are reserved words in the SQL standard. With a properly configured database-schema.xml file in Orion, this will be resolved in deploy time, but that is not guaranteed to work with all databases.    I used our JDBC Validator (that validates all sql sent through a jdbc driver against the SQL-92, SQL-99 and SQL-200x draft) during the deployment and here are my findings:  1. create table Action... Action is a reserved word in SQL-92 and SQL-99.  2. create table Issue... Key (a column) is reserved in SQL-92 and SQL-99.  3. create table Project ... same as 2  4. create table os_PropertyData .. Value is reserved in SQL-92, SQL-99 and SQL-200x  5. create table os_PropertyDate... same as 4.  6. create table os_PropertyDecimal... sames as 4.  7. create table os_PropertyNumber... same as 4.  8. create table os_PropertyString... same as 4.  9. create table os_PropertyEntry... same as 2    All the above reserved words are likely to be reserved in many databases, so it might be a good idea to change them (you can find all the reserved words at http://developer.mimer.se/validator/sql-reserved-words.tml)
fields.summary: Database schema uses SQL-99 reserved words

fields.description: - Remove description pane  - change comments / changelog to be tabbed panes  - other UI improvements
